title: HNLMS De Ruyter
author: Unknown
pages:
HNLMS De Ruyter was
a light cruiser of the
Dutch navy during WW2
Due to her being
designed during the
Great Depression, she
had a weak armament
relative to other light
cruisers of the time.
During WW2, De Ruyter
saw action around the
Dutch East Indies,
modern Indonesia.
Here, she fought in a

couple minor battles,
until the Battle of the
Java Sea, where she
served as the
flagship of Dutch
Rear-Admiral Karel
Doorman.
During the battle, she
engaged the Japanese
heavy cruisers Naichi
and Haguro. A torpedo
struck her, causing
her to catch fire and
sink alongside the

Dutch cruiser Java.
Karel Doorman went
down with his ship.
